definition: to fall behind the ranks/to be outdated
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
squad of five soldiers/to associate with/five (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
surname Wu

sentences.english: By 1840, the early cotton-producing states had been left behind.
sentences.chinese: 到了1840年，最早的產棉州落伍了。

sentences.english: It’s just that I don’t want to be a loser again.
sentences.chinese: 我只是不想再次成爲一個失敗的落伍者。

sentences.english: Over time, manicures for men went out of fashion.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間過去，男性的指甲修護逐漸落伍。

sentences.english: Through man's spirit of ingenuity he has made himself obsolescent as a worker.
sentences.chinese: 人的聰明才智使他自己變成了過時落伍的工人。

sentences.english: If we don't learn anything more, we would fall behind the times.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們不學新東西就會落伍。

sentences.english: This may seem a quaintly old-fashioned idea.
sentences.chinese: 這似乎是一個古怪而落伍的想法。

sentences.english: Conscience-stricken people may draw back for a while and consequently lag behind for a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 內疚抱愧的人會一時上退卻以至於一輩子落伍。

sentences.english: You're behind the times, Arthur, you're old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 你落伍了，亞瑟，你太老套。

sentences.english: Still go studying moss-grown person energy of life and hair post measure.
sentences.chinese: 還是去學習落伍的人氣和發帖數量吧。

sentences.english: Sometimes our encounters with new current of thought don't suggest that we are behind the times in thinking.
sentences.chinese: 有時我們與新思潮的衝突並不表明我們的思想落伍了。

sentences.english: In the life stage, never give a medal to the lagging.
sentences.chinese: 在人生舞臺上，從不給落伍者頒發獎牌。

sentences.english: My perspective is the old way. These students are learning the new way.
sentences.chinese: 我的觀點已經落伍了，而學生們正在學習新方法。

sentences.english: Anyone who stops absorbing new knowledge is certain to lag behind.
sentences.chinese: 免何己假如結束吸取舊學問，便確定會落伍。

sentences.english: The lagging man tagged the bags in the luggage dawn tiny flags.
sentences.chinese: 落伍者給行李中的袋子加上小旗標題。

sentences.english: Alex: Today's armies are weaponed with guns. Your bowmen are out of fashion.
sentences.chinese: 現在的軍隊都是用槍武裝的，您的弓箭手落伍了。

sentences.english: In recent years, teachers' salaries have fallen behind those of other non-manual workers.
sentences.chinese: 連年來，西席的薪水已經落伍於其他非體力勞動者了。

definition: old-fashioned/out of date/to be later than the time stipulated or agreed upon
to be ahead of one's time/to surpass or outdo one's predecessors/to be ahead of the pack/to take the lead/advanced
tide/current/trend
very old/obsolete/out of date
new generation of youths (generation X, Y etc)
reform and renewal/generational change
modern/fashionable
conservative/reactionary
alternative/non-mainstream
to keep up with the latest fashion
to decline/to wane
abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
the same old stuff
offbeat/alternative/avant-garde/unconventional/weird
drop in price/devalued/to have one's status lowered
